variants.Description in input context: c.66G>A (p.G22D) mutation associated with increased alpha-synuclein aggregation
c.173A>G (p.N58G) mutation linked to early-onset Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: HEK293 cells were transiently transfected with wild-type and mutant SNCA constructs.

Readout description.Result Description: Protein expression levels were 20% higher in p.G22D mutants compared to wild-type.
p.N58G mutants showed 35% increased aggregation in immunoprecipitation assays.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent transfections were performed for each construct.

Technical replicates.Description: Each Western blot was run in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type SNCA served as the positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty plasmid vector was used as the negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test with p < 0.05 considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein expression within 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein expression deviating by >25% from wild-type levels.

Material used.Description: Brain tissue from SNCA transgenic mice (p.G22D and p.N58G models) was analyzed.

Readout description.Result Description: Lewy body-like inclusions were observed in 80% of dopaminergic neurons in p.G22D mice.
Neuronal degeneration was detected in 65% of mice in the p.N58G model.

Biological replicates.Description: Five mice per genotype were analyzed.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mouse brain tissue served as the positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic mouse brain tissue served as the negative control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No Lewy body-like inclusions in dopaminergic neurons.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Lewy body-like inclusions in >50% of dopaminergic neurons.
